description: From Middle English beloken, biloken, equivalent to be- +â€Ž look.

verbs.description: belook (third-person singular simple present belooks, present participle belooking, simple past and past participle belooked)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To look about or around; look over or across; look after; give a look to; look at.
examples: They sighed and answered, "O our brother, some one must have belooked us with the evil eye and there is no security in travel.
